alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Chisago; Ramsey; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 11 at 8:13PM CDT until May 11 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Chisago County in east central Minnesota... Anoka County in east central Minnesota... Washington County in east central Minnesota... Ramsey County in east central Minnesota... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 813 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over St. Louis Park, or 7 miles west of Minneapolis, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Brooklyn Center around 820 PM CDT. Brooklyn Park, Roseville and Columbia Heights around 825 PM CDT. Fridley, Shoreview, New Brighton, Mounds View and Arden Hills around 830 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Vadnais Heights, Blaine, Lino Lakes, Hugo, Forest Lake, Scandia and Stacy. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central and east central Minnesota...and northwestern and west central Wisconsin. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central and east central Minnesota...and northwestern and west central Wisconsin.
